title: Watch Oscars host Jimmy Kimmel hilariously take aim at Donald Trump, Mel Gibson and Meryl Streep in opening monologue
text:
Watch Oscars host Jimmy Kimmel hilariously take aim at Donald Trump, Mel Gibson and Meryl Streep in opening monologue The TV star got straight to politics at Sunday's 89th annual Academy Awards Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Jimmy Kimmel's hilarious Oscars monologue Share this video Get celebs   Thank you for subscribing!   
First-time Oscars host Jimmy Kimmel wasted no time before he took aim at President Donald Trump - and others - in his opening monologue. 
"This broadcast is being watched live by millions of Americans and around the world in more than 225 countries that now hate us," he said from inside the Dolby Theatre in Hollywood. 
He continued: "The country is divided right now," he said, explaining that he would not be the man to bring the country together. "There's only one Brave Heart in the room and he's not going to unite us either." 
The camera then cut to Mel Gibson, nominated for best director. "Mel, you look great," Kimmel said. "The Scientology is helping." 
He also reignited his long-running 'feud' with Matt Damon. Jimmy Kimmel roasts nemesis Matt Damon (Photo: XPUSJP) Oscars Awards Show (Photo: REUTERS) (Photo: jimmykimmel/Instagram) Who won Oscars at the 2017 Academy Awards? Full winners list 
Kimmel earnestly encouraged everyone watching to reach out to someone during this divided time in the political climate, before explaining that he was ready to "bury the hatchet" with someone he has "had issues with" - Matt. 
"I've known Matt for a long time," Kimmel said. "When I first met Matt, I was the fat one." 
Kimmel then took a jab at Damon for giving Casey Affleck his Oscar-nominated role in Manchester by the Sea and making "a Chinese pony tail movie instead," in reference to The Great Wall. 
Then, back to politics, Kimmel reverted back to another presidential slam. Host Jimmy Kimmel (Photo: Rex Features) Luciana Barroso and actor Matt Damon (Photo: Getty Images North America) 
"I want to say thank you to President Trump," he said. "Remember last year when it seemed like the Oscars were racist? That's gone, thanks to him." 
The late night host rattled off a string of jokes about the nominated films and actors. His go-to joke, repeated several times with slightly different wording, is that no one in the audience saw any of the movies. 
Then, before his time was up, Kimmel gave due attention to Meryl Streep, who sat front and center in the Dolby Theatre. Actor Meryl Streep (Photo: Getty Images North America) Read More Oscars stage prop comes crashing down during rehearsals just hours before Academy Awards ceremony starts 
Kimmel praised Streep's many "overrated performances," referencing Trump's post-Golden Globes tweet. As the camera turned on her, Meryl tried in vain to hide behind her husband. 
"Meryl Streep has phoned it in for over 50 films in her lackluster career," he said. "She wasn't even in a movie this year. We just wrote her name down out of habit." 
Finally, Kimmel called the audience to give Streep a "totally undeserved round of applause" and the crowd rose immediately to give her a rousing standing ovation. 
But Kimmel couldn't let her go without referencing the drama surrounding Streep's gown for the evening: "Nice dress, by the way." he said. "Is that an Ivanka?" Read More Ruth Negga (Photo: REUTERS) Read More Oscars 2017 best dressed: Karlie Kloss, Emma Stone, Ruth Negga and more bring glamour to the Academy Awards carpet 
The red carpet also became a political one as celebrities subtly protested President Trump and his administration's policies. 
Ruth Negga, who is nominated for her role in Loving, in which she plays the real-life Mildred Loving, who was jailed for entering a mixed-race marriage with husband Richard in 1950s Virginia, sported a blue ACLU ribbon in support of the American Civil Liberties Union. 
Karlie Kloss, Busy Philipps, and Lin Manuel Miranda also sported the ribbon.
